derivation: or שָׂפַק; (1 Kings 20:10; Job 27:23; Isaiah 2:6), a primitive root;
outline:
1. to clap, slap
    1. (Qal)
      1. to slap, clap
      2. to slap, chastise
      3. to splash, throw up
    2. (Hiphil) to cause to clap
strongs_def: to clap the hands (in token of compact, derision, grief, indignation, or punishment); by implication of satisfaction, to be enough; by implication of excess, to vomit
